You're part of a stalking that's been going
on for 90 days, boy. Do you hear me?

The squirrel himself, how
you doing Mr Squirrel?

Scientology is one of the world's most
mysterious and

controversial organisations. Now, it could
be facing one if it's biggest challenges yet,

as Marty Rathburn, a senior member of the
church, has escaped.
I'm the amble that can break all hammers.

He lifts the lid on the inner secrets of
Scientology, as the tactics

he once helped devise
are used against him.

- Come on Marty, got anything to say?
- His actions clearly show that he is anti-scientology.

He's perceived as a danger to Scientology,
not just for his insider knowledge,

but because he's become a rallying point
for other dissidents around the world.

That little rat is
trapped in that house.

Can he survive
and set up an independent version

of Scientology as the weight of
the church comes down on him and his wife?

What if they kidnap me or something like
that? To get him to stop what he's doing.

This is the thing with these
guys, they just keep cranking it up.

Or will he be destroyed by the
very organization he helped build?

Scientology was born on the 1950s when
science-fiction writer L Ron Hubbard

wrote a self-help book he claimed could
save mankind. Dianetics was

advertised as a powerful alternative
to psychotherapy.

In 1977, college drop-out
Marty Rathbun became interested

in Hubbard's Church of Scientology.
With a family history of mental illness,

he'd just discovered his brother
had been sectioned.

My brother was a
diagnosed schizophrenic.

I had left college, I was gonna travel around
the world and write novels, and books, and

find answers, and my father called me at the
end of the first summer I was out, and told

me my brother got institutionalized. And I
encountered scientology during that ordeal.

I took a communications course
which I think really helped me.

Marty was audited, a key part of scientology
which involves being questioned

whilst being hooked up to an e-meter, a sort
of lie detector, to uncover past trauma.

I signed a billion year contract
to make it my life's work,

and I spent 27 years in the
Sea Organisation, that's how I got into Scientology.

A dedicated member, Marty joined the church's
elite sea organization, which had adopted

a naval style uniform and hierarchy. He quickly
rose up its ranks, working in founder L Ron

Hubbard's personal service. He also worked
closely with David Miscavige, a rising young

power in the organization, and was displayed
as his right hand man. One night, in January

1986, Hubbard's church would change forever.
It was 25-year old David Miscavige who delivered

the news of Hubbard's death, presenting
himself as his natural successor.

Hello. My name is David Miscavige,
and I'm very happy

that you could all make  it to this
important briefing this evening.

He was short tempered, ruthlessly loyal
to Hubbard and that was in that

culture at that time, was the
 winning hand.

In 1980, LRH moved off the lines so
that he could continue his writings
and researches without any distractions.

Being a messenger he had a leg up
and he became accomplished at the art of
the politics of scientology.

At 2000 hours, Friday, the 24th of
January, in AD 36,

L Ron Hubbard discarded
the body he had used in this lifetime.

L Ron Hubbard is now god,
and he's appointed Jesus, and so he's

Jesus Christ to Scientologists,
and it's a matter of belief.

We wanna make sure that all of us
encircle on this completely,

so we can get on with the
job that is ahead of us.

Within a year, Miscavige had taken
control.

He had promoted Marty to one of the
most powerful positions in scientology.

As this church publication reveals, Marty was
tasked with keeping Scientology free from

subversion. He ruthlessly defended Miscavige's
regime, and protected it's innermost secrets.

To progress spiritually in Scientology, you
must go through a number of stages, that can

cost thousands of dollars, and take many years.
Only the most dedicated are told the secrets

of level 3, in which Scientology's history
of mankind is finally revealed.

75 million years ago, a tyrant named Xenu ruled
the galactic confederation, a coalition of 76

planets. One of these planets, Teegeeack, which we
now call Earth. The confederation was suffering

from an over-population problem, so Xenu had
billions of people drugged and sent to Earth.

He placed their paralysed bodies around volcanoes,
in which he dropped hydrogen bombs. With the

bodies now blown up, only the souls, or as
Hubbard calls them, Thetans, were left. So they

wouldn't try to return, Xenu captured these
Thetans and implanted them with ideas like

religion. The souls were left disorientated and
clustered together. The Thetans entered whatever

human bodies they could still find, according to
Hubbard, these Thetans remain in our bodies

and are the source of all human woes.
Scientology aims to completely clear an
individual of their body Thetans.

I just find that such a deception that it's
not until you've given them 100,000 dollars

they say oh, by the way, your body's
infested with hundreds of thousands of invisible

alien beings. How many people would join
Scientology if they were told that on day one?

In church pictures, Miscavige is positioned
at the very heart of operations, with

the spirit of L Ron Hubbard in the background.
Marty was in charge of punishing anyone
who questioned either of them.

We put them on the RPF, which is a prison

critics, or punishing someone who had an irrelevant
thought about David Miscavige or L Ron Hubbard.

I had apparently very thoroughly insulted

and he's pushing, pushing pushing. And then

he slams his hand on the desk and says 'stop

Karen was married to the faith's

That's our wedding picture,
he was the figure head of scientology.

- This is John Travolta and Heber.
- So they went out quite a lot, then?

Were they good friends?

Marty was a key architect of the office

When I exited the sea org, I did

Class 12 certificates, these were glorious

Karen immediately found  herself cut

The vengeance was incredible.
Within one week of me stepping

35 years of the church and 1 week out of the

Just like that, bam. And then within 12 days of

Mom, never text me, never email me, never

There were voices in the background, I'm positive

The church has denied

My name is Tony Ortega, I'm a journalist
who's been writing about the church of

But church leaders had bigger problems.
Unless Scientology could

be recognized as a religion, they'd have to

We probably had one quarter of that in total

We had hundreds if not thousands of lawsuits

It was a coordinated harassment campaign to

Marty Rathbun and I

Off we proceeded to 1111 Constitution

there to see the commissioner of the IRS.

Is he expecting you, they asked? No, was our

We essentially told him, look, it's draining a tremendous

There will be no billion dollar

There will be no more discrimination,
there will be no more nothing.

The commissioner was just
exhausted of all the constant attacks, I've

talked to previous IRS commissioner who went
through the same thing, and they would call

him in the middle of the night, I mean it
was just constant harassment that the church

just finally brought, the IRS, one of America's
most legendary organisations, to its knees.

The IRS issued letters recognizing Scientology
and every one of it's organisations as
fully tax exempt, so the war is over.

Marty's next big mission was to pull
off the ultimate PR coup,

finding a poster boy for scientology.
His target? Tom Cruise.

The church of Scientology works hard to attract
big names, even creating special centres for

celebrities. Tom Cruise had become interested
in scientology after marrying actress Mimi

Rogers, a second generation scientologist.
When they broke up, he married Nicole Kidman

and drifted away. Now the biggest movie star
in the world, and his marriage to Nicole failing,

the time was right to make him
the new church's poster boy.

Cruise started making some
noises about getting some help.

Miscavige had me drop everything
and that became number one priority.

I helped him on his divorce with Nicole,
and then I was auditing him and helping

him get Penelope auditing, and I was
helping him in all aspects of his life.

- And that won him back over to the church?
- Yeah.

Miscavige's blossoming friendship with
the star was to signal the end of Marty.

When Miscavige was beginning to hobnob

and he began to denigrate me a
bit in Tom's eyes, because I was his

biggest opinion leader having salvaged his

career. It was crazy. So Miscavige really
had to start undermining me, in front of Cruise.

at the end of 2003, he was assigned

no way you're ever gonna

punched the gas, thread the needle and got out
before it closed, and just took off down the highway.

But alone and away from the world he'd

Meanwhile, Miscavige celebrated Tom Cruise

I have never met  a more competent, a more

Soon after, Marty packed a bag,  and walked

Marty is still auditing and writing his 
blog, but has now rejected the label

of Scientologist. The independent
Scientology movement continues.

The Church of Scientology States that Marty
Rathbun has never been a part of its ecclesiastical

management and although he has been publicly
attacking the Church for four years, his claims

have had no discernible effect whatsoever.
It says there is no evidence of a global independent

movement and the Israeli mission in Haifa
only ever numbered a few people and that some

have since rejoined the Church. The church
of Scientology states there is nothing inappropriate

about using sustained legal pressure to obtain
legal redress and tha the idea harassment

was used to achieve tax-exempt status is "obvious
nonsense". It also denies sending the Squirrel

Busters. While acknowledging that some were
Scientologists, Squirrel Buster Productions

is a wholly separate organisation. The Church
of Scientology denies putting Marty under

surveillance but admits conducting a legal
investigation into him "in furtherance of
potential litigation".
